p: We conducted a challenge test with Edwardsiella tarda, which has a high pathogenicity on red seabream. Fish were fed with the control diet or diets containing 5% or 10% DMW-2 for 56 days before the challenge. These diets did not lead to a significant effect on fish growth. After being challenged with E. tarda, fish fed the diet including DMW-2 showed a higher survival ratio than did the control, and diets containing 10% DMW-2 resulted in the highest survival rate ( Figure 2).
